column4: I reconfigured the xserver using my monitors manual as reference and that not workd at all
i'm trying to put that nvidia card working for 4 months

so try again.  different settings.   when you get it right then it will work.    and you can use the "vesa" driver if needed to get it up and running.    i can't really help you with the nvidia driver particularly though
I don't know whatelse to change in xserver config
I'm intrigated with this issue cause the nvidia driver had worked with another debian distro
the monitor,  use the middle selection not advanced not simple and get as close as possable to what you know yours is.  that should give a "usable" range.
ok I'll try your suggestion but now I need to sleep :-)
it is also possable that the fbcon module is interfeering eith the vidio driver
I'm very thankfull for you help
I'll also investigate the fcon module for sure
you can try booting with "nosplash"  on the kernel line and see if it helps.
it's fbcon   frame buffer console  driver.   provides the mechenism for usplash
